title.main: Webpack - a utility for development and production
title.subtitle: A review of functionality and value added for a React SPA in NodeJS

body.paragraph: webpack[1] is a mature JS library.  its a utility, like a utility knife is useful from the kitchen, to the garage, to work

body.quote: If you have never used webpack, there are two concepts that will aid in understanding the toolset it offers.

body.paragraph: 1. It has development and production modes, which have have vastly different or even opposing objectives.

2. It is a community developed library, with many plugins to add niche functionality.  This is good, because it offers plugins for what people use and find high value.  It also make it as light weight.  However, it can also be disorienting for newcomers who are unfamiliar with the development history of the library.  One has to get granular to really understand its value.
I will describe what I have learned and high level communication about how I have used it.  There are many detailed examples in docs and blogs.
